moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Bf4 d6 3. h3 g6 4. Nf3 Bg7: I lost some edge in the opening, and I have to react someway.
moves.10... dxe5 11. dxe5 Nd5: Good move, but I needed to open the game a little.
moves.12. Bh2 Nd7b6 13. Qe2: After much time thinking. I have to free my knight f3 from the duty of guarding e5.
moves.16... Na4 17. Qb3 Be6 18. c4: ! bxc, Bxc, Bxc, QxB, the knight is en prise... not bad.
moves.18... Qc7 19. Nfg5: Blunder. It was better the other knight. I'm threatening NxB, c5xb6, and e6 is weak.
moves.19... Bf5 20. cxb5 Bxe4: Surprise! It was easy Bxe4, but then h6 would have kicked me.
moves.21. Qxa4: I thought about b6, but Rb8 and that's was all.
moves.22. e6: The rook can't save itself because QxB, but the queen has to move, freeing my rook, and... let's see what happens in f7, please...
moves.23. Ke2: Rd2, BxR, KxB was not that bad, since white rides away of the black diagonal's guardian.
moves.23... cxb5: Surprise! Hehe, my opponent is defending as a lion! :-)
moves.24. exf7+: Let's see what's happening up there.
moves.25... e5: Blocking my bishop and defending f7. This was a nice moment. I conceded my opponent (only -1 now) a post - maelstorm exchange as the dust sets down.
moves.30. Rg3 Bf5 31. Rxc3: The game is out of interest now, but I managed to get myself in some trouble anyway.
moves.37. Rc5 Kf5 38. Rdd5: A problem-like position... but no mate.
moves.38... Ke6: Last & definitive blunder. A game interesting for the strange midgame.
